intro: Anodendron affine var. effusum, commonly known as the soft-leaved anodendron, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its leaves are often arranged in whorls, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
